review_blob:
Smells fantastic! Floral, spruce, resin and citric aromas. Pours clear yellow with white head. Strong taste, medium bitterness, light sweetness. A bit too much of everything, I would say. Maybe too spicy?
Palate: Full body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter.

Pours hazy, brown/red with a white, frothy head. A weak smell of citrus and flowers. Medium bitterness, light sweetness. A bit disappointing. Smooth yet lively feeling in the mouth. Long, bitter finish.

My first thought of this beer was: "Is it even safe to drink this?!?" It stinks of a sulphurous compound such as crude oil or maybe rotten eggs(?). Pours pale golden with no head and no bubbles.
Medium to heavy sourness. It has some fruity flavours.
Slowly, I got more used to it while drinking it but still it wasnt quite a pure pleasure.
A fine beer with a decent character. Easy to drink. Good smell of bread or cereal. Hazy, yellow. White head. Lightly bitter. Light to medium body.

Ah! What a smell! Spruce, leaves and dough together with alcohol in the aroma. Pitch-black. Brown, small head.
Medium sweetness, lightly bitter taste. Great taste!
Light body, thin feel, soft carbonation; long, bitter finish.
A highly enjoyable stout! Yum-yum.
beer_name: To l Goliat Imperial Stout Bourbon Barrel Aged

review_blob:
Pleasant smell of bread, raisin and coffee. Black as a night at winter time. 
Very little foam. Medium sweetness, medium bitterness, a little salty.
It has a nice feel in the mouth; medium body, thin feel, soft carbonation, long finish with a distinct taste of coffee and chocolate.
Overall definitely an enjoyable beer!
beer_name: To l Goliat Imperial Coffee Stout

review_blob:
Light aroma. Licorice. Roasty.
Black. No head. Dead look.
Very powerful taste! Heavy sweetness, lightly bitter, slightly salty.
Full body, sticky, flat. Long, light bitterness in the aftertaste.
A heavy boy. A great beer.

Aroma: Caramel, cough drop. Resembles a port wine.
Appearance: dark brown. Nearly no head. A bit boring look.
Taste: medium to heavy sweetness.
Palate: medium body, sticky, soft carbonation.

A very sweet beer, which tends to be a bit too much. Share it with others for your own sake. Nevertheless, its a decent beer.

Aroma: Wonderful! Citrus, floral, spruce. Aaah!
Pours golden, hazy, sparkling, with white foam and fine laces.
Tastes wonderful too. It has it all. Perfect balance. Fresh, bitter, gentle to your mouth. Very bitter but not too much.
Light body, oily feel, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish.

Its best while its still cold.

Aroma: caramel, nuts.
Appearance: red/brown, hazy, long laces.
Taste: medium sweetness. Not a big pleasure.
Palate: light body, thin feel, flat, long sweet finish.
An OK drinkable beer.

Smells very nice of liqourice, caramel and chocolate.
Pours black with a brown frothy, head.
Medium bitterness, light sweetness.
Medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish.

In the beginning, I found it had too much smoke to it but it only gets better and better. A decent porter.
beer_name: Mikkeller X-mas Porter 2011 Til Fra Via (To From Via)

review_blob:
Smells fantastic. Floral, citrous and resin aroma.
Pours golden with small sediments, white head and fine laces.
Taste: medium bitterness, medium sweetness, lightly sour.
Palate: medium body, thin feel, soft carbonation, lightly metallic, long bitter finish.

An enjoyable beer at probably all occasions.

Aroma consists of caramel, coffee, chocolate, licorice and fresh water. It appears black, with a little white foam. Medium sweetness. Light body, oily feel, flat, long and pleasant finish, though I miss some more life in it. A bit boring. Overall an easy drinkable beer.

Smells of summer and berries! Though, this soon dissappears after pouring. It pours golden and hazy with a frothy but passing white head. Light sweetness, lightly bitter, refreshing and tasty. Light body, thin feel, average carbonation, long bitter finish which also turns a bit too sweet for my taste. It is, after all, a nice beer.

Notes of caramel and roasty malt. Its black with no head. The taste has a light sweetness and is lightly bitter but comes much stronger in the aftertaste. The body is light, the texture is oily and it has a long bitter finish. It feels good in the mouth. Its a decent beer.

It smells pleasantly like peach, apricot or maybe of some citrus fruit in addition to floral hops and spruce -- very enjoyable. It appears beautiful amber, sparkling and with a white head. The taste consists of medium sweetness and medium bitterness. It has a medium body, thin feel, average carbonation, bitter. I miss something in the taste besides of bitterness.
beer_name: Mikkeller Single Hop Sorachi Ace IPA

review_blob: Sweet&sour; taste with a complex composition. Fresh but intense. A pleasant beer. It has medium body and is a bit creamy. I like it. Would probably go very well with most foods.

Smells of smoked salmon and salami with a hint of sweetness. Pours reddish brown and sparkling. Reveals a light taste of smoke (maybe umami too?) and a palette of delicious spices. Yummy! It pleasantly coates the tongue and leaves behind the spicy taste for a long time. I really like this beer!

Distinct smell of cherries. Beuatiful ruby liquid, sparkling and nice lacings. Very sweet taste of cherries - actually a bit too much for my taste - but a bit freshness accompanies this, though. It has a light body and a flat carbonation. Feels like drinking juice. If you like very sweet stuff this beer might be worth to try, giving yourself a challenge.

Aroma: Sour/sweet, close and a bit queasy. 
Appearance: hazy, fine looking.
Taste: lightly sour, lightly bitter. Not so much taste as expected.
Palate: Drying out the tongue, stale, abrupt finish.
An OK beer. It can be enjoyed if you are very thirsty for beer.

Aroma: Caramel, chocolate, coffee, liquorice and roasty malt. Also some hops is hiding in there and is most easily recognized just after pouring.
Appearance: Dark brown/black color with a beautiful frothy, tanned head, which Id wish lasted just a bit longer to enjoy :-)
Taste: medium to heavy sweetness, lightly bitter, and a little salty. I dont think its going too sweet in spite of its weighty sweetness.
Palate: medium body, something in-between slick and thick. Average carbonation and a short bitter but long, salty and chocolate-like finish. Nice!

A delicate beer to enjoy on its own or with some dessert like chocolate or ice cream.

Aroma: Quite sweet in a pleasant way. Small nuances of yeast as in dark bread. I like it.
Appearance: The quintessence of a stout. Greyish, frothy foam with big bubbles. The liquid is black.
Taste: smoke, liquorice, heavy cloying sweetness; distinct, dark, malty taste with some of the classical notes of chocolate and coffee.
Palate: medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, abrupt finish.
A decent stout but a bit too sweet for my taste and I really miss a longer finish.

Aroma: Great freshness, citrus and summer flowers, wonderful smell!
Appearance: Pale and hazy with a minimal head.
Taste: Exciting and complex. Refreshing and well balanced, though unfortunately, the more you drink the more the sweetness and alcohol dominates, which is a drawback.
Palate: medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, bitter.
I think it is a very good beer but I wouldnt define it as a being a summer beer. On a hot summer day this beer would be quite a challenge to drink simply on its own.

Aroma: Very sweet, plum, caramel. Liquor-like. Wonderful smell.
Appearance: Brown with sediments. No head at all.
Taste: medium sweetness, lightly sour, grape -- resembles a bit of red wine.
Palate: medium body, creamy, average carbonation, medium sour well-balanced finish as when you drink a medium-dry red wine. Perfect feeling in the mouth! Yummy!
beer_name: Bush de Nuits (Scaldis Prestige de Nuits)

review_blob:
Aroma: Floral, herbs.
Appearance: golden, a bit hazy, beautiful.
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, well balanced, excellent sipper (or maybe even) swill beer!
Palate: medium body, thin feel, soft carbonation, bitter finish.
Overall: I really like this beer! Its a great pleasure to drink it and to let it entertain ones tastebuds. Enjoy!
beer_name: Three Floyds Pride & Joy Mild Ale

review_blob:
Wonderful floral, fruity aromas. Golden, clear, minimal head. Lightly bitter and sour but yet an undefinable taste. Light body, oily feel, soft carbonation and a long, bitter and smooth finish (coating).
Taste is a bit disappointing.

Aromas of hay and barnyard which I find simply unpleasant. Amber, clear, sparkling, minimal head. Lightly bitter, medium sourness. Light body, oily feel, flat, abrupt finish. Sorry, but not a beer I enjoyed drinking.
Citric and woody aromas. Golden, clear appearance with a minimal head. Lightly bitter and sour. Light body, though creamy; lively, expanding on the tongue; bitter, long finish.
Floral, citrus aroma. Golden/amber and clear with white foam. Medium bitterness. Medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter, long finish. Definitely a fine beer.
Scents of bread, flower, citrus and smoke. Appearance: golden, clear, frothy. Medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter, long finish. An interesting beer.
Summery scents of flowers and citrus fruit. Golden, clear and sparkling; a little frothy; very bitter, light body; thin feel, soft carbonation; a bitter, long finish. Overall a decent beer.
